intro: Seseli intramongolicum, commonly known as the Mongolian seseli, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its blooming period occurs in the summer months, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by supporting pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
